coupon.translation[0].definitions[0].def: a small piece of printed paper that gives you the right to pay less for something or get something free
coupon.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: The coupon entitles you to ten cents off your next purchase.
coupon.translation[0].definitions[1].def: a printed form, used when you order something, enter a competition etc
coupon.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: To order, fill in the coupon on page 154.
coupon.translation[1].definitions[0].def: a small piece of paper attached to certain types of bond, that you tear off and hand in so as to receive interest
coupon.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: The frequency of coupon payments can differ between bonds; for example, some bonds pay coupons quarterly, others pay coupons annually.
coupon.translation[1].definitions[1].def: the rate of interest paid on bonds
coupon.translation[1].definitions[1].exa: a new two-year bond with a 10% coupon
The high coupon is there to compensate high risk.
coupon.translation[1].definitions[2].def: a printed piece of paper given to customers by the seller of a product, allowing the customer to pay less than usual for the product when they next buy it, or to get a free gift
coupon.translation[1].definitions[3].def: a printed piece of paper given to people by the government, allowing them to buy a particular product or get something for free, usually during a war
